screeningSummary: Whistleblower with internal pharmaceutical documents showing cost-benefit analysis of hiding side effects

textVariants.text: You're on the air. I understand you have documents?
Alright, you're on. You said you have documents?
YOU ARE ON THE AIR! With DOCUMENTS! This is GONNA be GOOD!
You're on. Let me guess - you have explosive documents?
You're on. So you have documents? What about it?
Oh, you have DOCUMENTS! This I gotta hear! What's the story?
You're on. What specific documentation have you obtained?

dialogue.speaker: Caller
dialogue.text: Internal documents, Vern. From my time at a major pharmaceutical company. They knew about serious side effects of one of their flagship drugs and chose to hide it.

textVariants.text: Knew about the side effects and continued selling it anyway. That's serious.
Knew about side effects and kept selling... alright, go on.
THEY KNEW and HID IT?! This is HUGE! Tell me everything!
Knew about side effects and hid it. Of course they did. What'd you find?
Knew and hid it. That's criminal. What'd you find?
THEY KNEW and HID IT! This is INCREDIBLE! Tell me more!
Corporate knowledge of adverse effects with deliberate suppression. What was the scope of the concealment?

dialogue.speaker: Caller
dialogue.text: Cost-benefit analysis. Internal memos showed they calculated settlements would be cheaper than a recall. I have the spreadsheets showing projected lawsuits versus revenue loss. It was a business decision.

textVariants.text: That's criminal negligence at best.
That's... yeah, that's bad. Go on.
THEY DID A COST-BENEFIT ANALYSIS on HURTING PEOPLE! This is SICK!
Business decision. Of course it was. How many people got hurt?
That's criminal negligence. What else did you find?
They made a SPREADSHEET of PROFIT versus HUMAN SUFFERING! This is HORRIFYING!
Quantitative analysis of harm versus profit. What were the specific projections?

dialogue.speaker: Caller
dialogue.text: It's also standard practice in the industry. I've got documents from three different products. This isn't an anomaly - it's how the system works.

textVariants.text: Documents can be fabricated. How do we know these are authentic?
Documents can be fake... how do we know these are real?
THREE DIFFERENT PRODUCTS?! This is a PATTERN!
Documents can be fabricated. What's your proof they're real?
Documents can be faked. What's your evidence?
THREE PRODUCTS worth of DOCUMENTS! This is EXACTLY what we need!
Document authenticity verification. What chain of custody protocols have you established?

dialogue.speaker: Caller
dialogue.text: I've submitted copies to two independent investigative journalists. They're being authenticated by forensic document analysts. I've also kept chain of custody records from the moment I decided to come forward.

textVariants.text: Be careful. Whistleblowers face significant retaliation. Thank you for having the courage to come forward.
Yeah, be careful out there. Whistleblowing is dangerous. Thanks for calling.
BE CAREFUL! Whistleblowers get DESTROYED! But THANK YOU for your COURAGE!
Right, well... be careful. These companies don't play nice. Thanks.
Good work. Be careful. These people have lawyers. Thanks.
This is HEROIC! Thank you for being BRAVE! BE CAREFUL though!
Whistleblower retaliation is documented and significant. Protective measures should be prioritized. Thank you for your courage.

dialogue.speaker: Caller
dialogue.text: I know the risks. But people deserve to know what's being done in their name. Thank you for listening, Vern.

arcNotes: Whistleblower with documents, pharmaceutical industry negligence, forensic authentication in progress
